SEARCH
Package model.modelLocation

Class LocationModel

java.lang.Object
model.modelLocation.LocationModel
public class LocationModel extends Object
Represents a location in the game world.

A LocationModel contains information about its size, name, items, exits, local map structure, and optionally a monster. Locations also support initialization logic and exit/item placement.

  • Constructor Details

    • LocationModel

      public LocationModel(String name)
      Creates a location with a given name. Random items and possibly a monster are generated.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the location

    • LocationModel

      public LocationModel(String name, int width, int height, Map<Integer,ExitModel> exits, HashMap<Point,StepModel> locMap, ArrayList<ItemModel> itemList, MonsterModel monster)
      Creates a location with all attributes specified.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the location
      width - grid width
      height - grid height
      exits - map of exits
      locMap - grid mapping of steps
      itemList - list of items
      monster - monster present in the location (optional)

    • addExit

      public void addExit(ExitModel e, Integer key, int x, int y)
      Adds an exit to the location.
      Parameters:
      e - the exit to add
      key - unique key for the exit
      x - X coordinate where the exit is placed
      y - Y coordinate where the exit is placed

    • setExits

      public void setExits(ExitModel[] exits)
      Sets multiple exits in the location.
      Parameters:
      exits - array of exits to add

    • initItems

      public void initItems()
      Initializes the location with three random items. This method ensures that at least one container (like a chest or crate) is placed in the location if possible. After a container is found, only non-container items will be generated for the remaining slots. Each item is placed at a random unoccupied position within the location. If no free positions are available, some items might not be placed.

    • getExits

      public ArrayList<ExitModel> getExits()
      Returns the list of exits in this location.
      Returns:
      list of ExitModel

      Returns:
      the monster

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a human-readable name representing this location. This overrides the default toString method and returns a more user-friendly name based on the location's identifier.
